title: Ticket #5765: condor_history should honor SCHEDD_HOST if it is defined
description:
condor_history should default to a remote query to the schedd defined in SCHEDD_HOST when SCHEDD_HOST is defined.

Since you may still want to query the local history files explicitly even when SCHEDD_HOST is defined, a new argument -local will be added that will force the old behaviour of condor_history. i.e it will force it to will read from the configured history file(s)

As a part of this change, remote condor history will supply a projection for the default output, and a new option for streaming results will be added to condor_history and to the remote history query. We should consider adding support for streaming into the 8.4 release as well.
remarks:
2016-Jun-30 11:17:08 by johnkn:
The reason for the new streaming option is that the current remote condor_history wire protocol puts an End-of-Message only at the end of the entire response. This causes the client side to buffer the results and to only hand them back to the condor_history code once all of the results have been recieved. Thus the current wire protocol results in condor_history not printing any output until all of the results have been recieved - and the entire result stream must fit into memory on the client side or the operation will fail and print nothing.
